There is no run(Test) on the swingui... use runSuite().

On Thu, 18 Apr 2002 19:02:45 +0530, "pragnesh.p"
<pragnesh.p@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated representation
> 
> 
>    Hi,
>           I  have  been  asked  to  do  some exploration on JUnit. I have
>    finished exploration of JUnit and JUnitPerf and am currently exploring
>    XmlUnit.
>           There  is  a  funny problem which i am facing currently. When I
>    compile test_XMLTestCase.java (a sample file given) with
>        public static void main(String[] args) {
>            (new junit.textui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
>        }
>    it compiles and runs without any problems.
>    However when i do the following change
>        public static void main(String[] args) {
>            (new junit.swingui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
>        }
>    It gives following error:
>    test_XMLTestCase.java:297: cannot resolve symbol
>    symbol  : method run  (junit.framework.TestSuite)
>    location: class junit.swingui.TestRunner
>            (new junit.swingui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
>            ^
>    1 error
>    Does any one have an idea of watz happening.
>    Regards
>    Pragnesh
>    -----Original Message-----
>    From: Shunsuke Masuda [mailto:smasuda@...]
>    Sent: Thursday, April 18, 2002 6:27 PM
>    To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>    Subject: Re: [junit] Junit's Importance
>    Hello,
>    I was also in need of explaning the advantages of JUnit to both
>    managers and co-workers. My explanation was like this:
>    JUnit itself is not so important(forgive me if I'm arrogant here);it
>    is the test-first development style and adhering to the style that
>    matters. Today you can write executable and automated test cases to
>    enfoce   the  style,  and  using  JUnit  is  one  solution.If  there's
>    widely-accepted
>    one, why not use it instead of writing your own with non-overlookable
>    time( and cost).
>    Might be a pointless, though hope this helps.
>    Regards,
>    Shunsuke Masuda
>    ----- Original Message -----
>    From: <arathi.bhaskar@...>
>    To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
>    Sent: Wednesday, April 17, 2002 8:38 PM
>    Subject: [junit] Junit's Importance
>    > Hi
>    >
>    >  I  am  familiar  with  Junit  for a month or two month. I have also
>    started to
>    >  look  into Cactus project for servlet testing. I am one of the very
>    few
>    >  people  in  the  organization  to  know  about this & want to share
>    Junit's
>    > features & advantages with others & convince them of its use. I have
>    tested
>    >  some Java programs with Junit. I gave a presentation to my managar,
>    to see
>    > if we can pilot the use of Junit in some project.
>    >
>    > Can someone tell me the real advantages of using Junit over the
>    >  individual's  own  Unit  testing of the Java Code written by him. I
>    have been
>    > reading the articles posted on Junit homepage. Where can I find more
>    > articles giving the advantages of Junit.
>    >
>    > Thanks & Regards
>    > Arathi
